alert.note: Alert for Lafayette; Panola; Tate (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 09 at 3:30PM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Lafayette, south central Tate and northeastern Panola Counties through 400 PM CDT... At 330 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Como, or 7 miles northwest of John W Kyle State Park, moving southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for northwestern Mississippi.
